message.content: This question requires understanding of basic astronomical concepts. When a planet revolves around a star, it is exposed to the solar rays emitted by the star. Solar rays refer to the light and radiation emitted by the star, which the planet receives as it orbits around it. Option (A) is incorrect because mountains are not directly relevant to a planet's orbit around a star. Option (B) is incorrect because oceans are specific to Earth and not all planets have oceans. Option (D) is incorrect because moons are not necessarily present in every planetary system.

This question requires basic knowledge about planetary systems and the effects of stars on planets. When a planet revolves around a star, it is exposed to solar rays, which are the electromagnetic radiation emitted by the star. Option (A) is incorrect because mountains are physical features on a planet and not directly related to the star. Option (B) is incorrect because oceans are bodies of water on a planet and not directly related to the star. Option (D) is incorrect because moons are smaller celestial bodies that orbit a planet, not the star itself.
